item.title: Hypothesis Testing: Formulas and Widely Used Tests
item.description: Introduction Hypothesis testing is a fundamental statistical technique used to make informed decisions and draw conclusions about populations based on sample data. It allows researchers to assess whether an observed effect is statistically significant or due to chance. In this article, we will explore the key concepts of hypothesis testing, delve into the formulas involved, and examine some commonly used tests. Understanding Hypothesis Testing Hypothesis testing involves two competing hypotheses: the null hypothesis (H0) and the alternative hypothesis (Ha).
